content: barely a beret a design by sara j wolf aknitwizard about this pattern this design can be worn either as a beret or a slouchy hat the choice of style has much to do with the kind of yarn you choose this one above is knit from hand spun and the base fiber has silk in it that s where much of the slouch comes from if you use a yarn with more body see image on last page it will look more like a classic beret this beret was strongly blocked to retain the crease that you see but because of the drapey nature of the yarn quickly loses the form and goes back to more of a slouchy hat another note about the yarn choice my handspun isn t perfectly even so matching it to a commercial yarn was a little difficult this is more-or-less a dk weight but i strongly suggest you check the gauge with your yarn choice to make sure your hat will fit this is a pretty generic hat design so you can up or down the stitch count for fit keeping in mind to distribute the stitches evenly and in a number that mirrors the pattern decreases materials 150 yards/145 m dk weight yarn commercial dk yarn such as kelbourne woolens scout us size 5 3 75 mm 16 circular needle us size 5 3 75mm double point needles stitch markers tapestry needle for weaving in ends sizes small/medium large/x-large gauge 24 sts/4 in stockinette abbreviations k knit p purl m1 make 1 insert the left needle from front to back through the bar between two stitches and knit through the back ssk slip the next two stitches knit-wise to the right needle return the two stitches to the left needle and knit them together through the back loop k2tog knit two stitches together through the front of the stitch regular knitting stitch sm slip marker s1 k2tog psso slip 1 stitch knit the next 2 stitches together then pass the slipped stitch over the stitch made from knitting 2 together this is known as a center double decrease instructions with circular needles and using the long-tail method cast on 100 108 stitches and join in the round work k2xp2 ribbing for 2 inches increase as follows k2 m1 around for a total of 150 162 stitches knit all rounds until you have worked 4 inches from the increase round on the last row knit 25 27 stitches place marker repeat around decrease as follows note a different decrease style is shown on the last page round 1 *ssk knit to 2 stitches before the next marker k2tog sm* repeat from * to * round 2 knit all stitches repeat rounds 1 and 2 until 18 stitches remain changing to double point needles when necessary finishing cut yarn leaving a tail of at least 6 inches
